repo.name: goread
repo.description: Beautiful program to read your RSS/Atom feeds right in the terminal!

readme.summary: The documentation is well-structured and provides clear instructions for installation, configuration, and usage, but lacks a concise quick start guide and troubleshooting section.

injection_risks.description: The command uses the EDITOR environment variable to construct a command, which can lead to arbitrary command execution if the variable is tampered with.
The command splits the EDITOR environment variable and path using spaces as delimiters, which may not be secure if the editor or path contains spaces.

critical_findings: Arbitrary command execution vulnerability in cmd/edit.go
security.summary: The goread package has some security concerns, including potential arbitrary command execution and lack of input validation, but no hardcoded secrets or critical error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: readonly config, can't mark as read
Panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
sentiment.summary: The community is generally neutral with some frustration over configuration and stability issues, but there are positive contributions in the form of feature requests.

red_flags: Some responses are vague and lack detail
There's a mix of helpful and unhelpful responses
communication.summary: The maintainer provides some useful information but could be more consistent in clarity and depth.

concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of active development.
Only one merged PR in the past six months.
positive_signals: 8 contributors have been active in the past six months, suggesting some level of community or individual interest.
The package has received updates and had issues addressed since its last release.
maintenance.summary: The package is minimally maintained with occasional contributions but lacks recent development activity.
